column4: I am trying to upgrade 8.10 to 9.04 with the Update Manager. The process appears to have stopped. It says it is "Getting new packages" and the progress bar is one pixel from completion, but it's been stuck like that for about ten minutes and there's no significant CPU activity. What should I do?
see http://imagebin.ca/view/Pd-Bj48.html
hm, OK
the last activity in /var/log/dist-upgrade was 35 minutes ago...
wait like 30 minutes to an hour....
you'd be surprised
it's always better to backup important data and do a full install from scratch
define better. it takes a long time for me to get things working as i want each time i install from scratch. i was hoping the upgrade path would do all that for me
it worked last time...
well it installs a much more "Clean" system...Updating can cause a mess...much like sweeping the dirt under the rug instead of putting it in the trash can
clean and less full-featured. yes.
I can understand the reason for not wanting to do a full install but it's definitely better than an update
not sure actually
see? not so bad is it
right. it shouldn't have hung, though
it happens
evidently. i'll be upgrading to 9.04 -> 9.10 -> 10.04. so i have lots of fun times ahead, it seems
in that case i'd just do a full install man...
that many upgrades can and most likely will cause an issue
thing is, i also have non-ubuntu software in /opt which i want to keep

well, i guess the worst that can happen is that things don't really work and i have to do a reinstall after the fact. but i reckon there's a reasonable chance that it will work as advertised. so i'll try it this way first
alright...
